title: Category Theory For Beginners: Kan Extensions

media:group.media:title: Category Theory For Beginners: Kan Extensions
media:group.media:description:
In this video we introduce, define, and describe how to compute Kan extensions. Together with adjoint functors,  Kan extensions are some of the most powerful concepts in category theory. 

Discussion of the adjoint functors related to dependent type theory can be found around
2:25:30 of 
https://youtu.be/Wh1QxF5FLJw

More details about constructing intermediary arrows for colimits in Set can be found here

https://youtu.be/xn4xP8XpFCM

https://youtu.be/vgmC_EtZ5_A

The 3rd, 4th and 5th video in this playlist describe a variety of different structured sets

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gKYpvyQPhZo&list=PL4FD0wu2mjWM3ZSxXBj4LRNsNKWZYaT7k&index=1


My notes about Kan extensions can be found here

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1GewSqKbi6ehoceQQjdxkepq8dk6yOx4m?usp=sharing

A discussion of how Kan extensions can be used to find adjoint functors can be found here:

https://youtu.be/m5-XmnxNG3c

The following videos describe more precisely how to find Kan extensions in general, when dealing with the category Set.

https://youtu.be/9B2_Zu95fTc
https://youtu.be/hxoHgF5_bR0
https://youtu.be/z8ZXgQc22XE
